entry.title: Karabakh NGOs urge UN to condemn Baku‚Äôs cultural crimes

media:group.media:title: Karabakh NGOs urge UN to condemn Baku‚Äôs cultural crimes
media:group.media:description:
üìç Security Treaty Organization, the country‚Äôs Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan said in parliament. Lawmaker Hovik Aghazaryan, recently expelled from the ruling Civil Contract party, alleged yesterday that Armenia‚Äôs Investigative Committee passed personal data from his confiscated phone to Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan. Parliamentary Speaker Alen Simonyan accused Aghazaryan of leaking classified information to the media. üìç A group of NGOs from Nagorno-Karabakh appealed to UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres and UNESCO Director General Audrey Azoulay to send a mission that would document cultural crimes and heritage destruction committed by Azerbaijan in the region. üìç The first group of Syrian Armenians awaiting evacuation will arrive in Yerevan next week, Hovhannes Alexanyan, a senior official at Armenia‚Äôs Office for Diaspora Affairs, announced.

entry.title: Visa's financial inclusion agenda for Armenia

media:group.media:title: Visa's financial inclusion agenda for Armenia
media:group.media:description:
Partner content
In this interview, Cristina Doros, Senior Vice President and Group Country Manager for Visa in the former Soviet region, provides a comprehensive look at the rapidly evolving digital payments landscape across the Caucasus, Central Asia, and neighboring markets. Drawing on her experience spearheading Visa's strategies and partnerships, Doros shares perspectives on the factors driving fintech adoption and her vision for the future of cashless transactions.

entry.title: Finding purpose after the war and loss of Artsakh #shorts

media:group.media:title: Finding purpose after the war and loss of Artsakh #shorts
media:group.media:description:
Today‚Äôs guest on Mindful Leaders is Tatev Petrossian, an inspiring designer, entrepreneur, and a visionary. Born to Armenian parents and raised in France, Tatev‚Äôs deep ancestral connection to the regions of Mush, Sasun, Van, and Yegheknadzor has shapedf her life journey. After working in financial and strategy management, Tatev founded Revolve Consulting, a company centred on design thinking and the circular economy. However, the war in Artsakh triggered a powerful transformation in her life. Confronting pain and loss, she found strength and channelled her emotions into a driving force for change. This shift led her to design with a deeper, purpose-driven focus. In 2022, Tatev and her sister Emma founded Atelier79, a French-Armenian fine jewellery studio that challenges traditional norms by infusing each unique piece with rich stories. This episode delves into Tatev‚Äôs passion for creativity and innovation. We discuss how she has used her entrepreneurial journey to create design spaces encouraging mindfulness, meaning, and compassion. Through her work, Tatev reminds us that despite life‚Äôs challenges, we always have the choice to pursue endeavours with purpose, vision, and consciousness.

media:group.media:title: The risks facing Aleppo‚Äôs Armenians
media:group.media:description:
In this CivilNet podcast, political analyst Eric Hacopian provides an in-depth assessment of the rapidly deteriorating situation in Aleppo, Syria, where rebel forces backed by Turkey have launched a major offensive. Hacopian examines the key players involved, the potential motivations behind the timing of this escalation, and the grave threats posed to the remaining Armenian community trapped in the crossfire.

entry.title: Armenia approves increase in military spending

media:group.media:title: Armenia approves increase in military spending
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia‚Äôs parliament passed the state budget for 2025, which sees a significant increase in military spending. The country‚Äôs opposition voted against the bill. üìç The World Bank Group released a comprehensive climate and development report on Armenia, revealing the nation's intricate challenges in greenhouse gas emissions, energy security, and environmental sustainability. üìç Armenia‚Äôs ruling Civil Contract party announced seven candidates for the mayoral primaries in Gyumri, the country‚Äôs second-largest city. The list includes a relative of Anna Hakobyan, the wife of Armenia‚Äôs Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan. üìç How the ICC warrant for Netanyahu empowers Armenia against Aliyev: https://youtu.be/iQ3JBH6fdEs?si=xg314dw58CUer8l7
